q1.name: Decimating Smash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to 2 seconds to swing in the target direction, increasing ''Decimating Smash's'' range every {{fd|0.25}} seconds, up to 1 second, and its damage every {{fd|0.25}} seconds, up to a maximum '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''base''' damage|physical damage}} and up to 200% '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''scaling''' damage|physical damage}}. ''Decimating Smash'' can be recast at any time within its duration, and automatically does so at its end.
If the channel is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, ''Decimating Smash'' goes on a 2-second {{sti|cooldown}}.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Sion''' flails his axe, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in the target area and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 50% for {{fd|0.25}} seconds. ''Decimating Smash'' deals 150% damage against {{tip|monster|monsters}} and 60% damage against {{tip|minion|minions}}.

If ''Decimating Smash'' was charged for at least 1 second, '''Sion''' instead slams his axe down, {{tip|airborne|knocking up}} all enemies hit for {{passive progression/deprecated version|type=channel time|11|0.5 to 1|1 to 2|formula=0.5+(0.05 every 0.1 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''}} seconds and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{passive progression/deprecated version|type=channel time|11|1.25 to 2.25|1 to 2|formula=1.25+(0.1 every 0.1 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''}} seconds.

q1.notes:
[[File:Sion hitbox area.png|thumb|For the target to be hit, their center needs to be inside the red or blue areas (based on charge time), and their edge must hit the yellow part of the cone. If their edge also hits the white part of the cone they will be excluded from being hit. Cone is at 16 degrees and starts 800 range behind Sion's center. White cone has a radius of 720, while yellow cone has a radius of 1550.]]
* '''Sion''' himself remains {{tip|lockout|locked out}} of all actions for {{fd|0.25}} seconds when releasing ''Decimating Smash''.
** Trying to cast {{ai|Soul Furnace|Sion}} will buffer the cast until '''Sion''' is no longer locked out or otherwise prevented from casting it, while {{ai|Roar of the Slayer|Sion}} and {{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} will not buffer.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will prevent ''both'' the knock up and the stun.
* Since the {{tip|stun}} duration is longer than the {{tip|airborne}} duration, and both start at the same time, {{tip|Tenacity}} is still fully effective against ''Decimating Smash'' up to a cap.
** This virtual cap is 60%-55.5% {{sti|Tenacity}} based on channel time beyond 1 second. Every value below this cap will lower the CC duration with no diminished returns.
* A flash of the axe and change in brightness of the indicator on the ground indicates when the 1 second time frame is reached.
* The damage of ''Decimating Smash'' is calculated when it is released. Gaining {{as|AD}} or upgrading the ability during its channel will update the damage of the coming hit. 
** Even though the [[cooldown]] starts when the ability is released, it will not be changed by gaining or losing [[Cooldown reduction|CDR]], or upgrading the ability, during the cast time.
* The indicator is visible to the enemy only if they {{tip|Sight|see}} '''Sion''' himself.
** If the channel is released before 1 second, enemies may see a particle at the far end of the hitbox, if it itself isn't outside of their {{tip|Sight|vision}}.
** If the channel is released after 1 second, the only remaining indication is the visual effects and audio that plays on any units the spell strikes (these play on-target), provided the enemy does have {{tip|Sight|vision}} on those.
* Forced movement without a {{tip|stun}} component (or the stun being {{tip|cleanse|cleansed}} previously) will not stop '''Sion''' from starting or continuing to channel. Its direction will not change with '''Sion's''' travel, however the location will update with him.
** The location of the indicator updates at the ''beginning'' of the ability, at ''1 second'' and at ''release''.
* The indicator of the ability is slightly shorter at its front than the hitbox of the ability is for {{csl|Sion}}, {{csl|Sion|Mecha Zero}} and related skins and chromas, while on {{csl|Sion|Worldbreaker}}, the indicator is slightly thinner at the front than the hitbox is, instead.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Sion''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:

e1.name: Roar of the Slayer
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' bellows in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for {{fd|2.5}} seconds as well as {{sti|armor penetration|{{as|reducing their armor by 20%}}}} for 4 seconds.

If the target is a {{tip|minion}} or non-epic {{tip|monster}}, it is {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds and {{tip|airborne|knocked back}}, in the same line, up to 1300 units away from '''Sion''', dealing the same damage and applying the same effects to all enemies it passes through as well as briefly {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area it goes through. Projectile enemies are {{tip|invulnerable}} to minion damage and take their damage once they are stopped if they would die to ''Roar of the Slayer's'' damage, by either colliding with terrain, reaching the end of their trajectory, or being {{tip|knockdown|knocked down}}.
e1.notes:
* Unlike the intial single-target [[projectile]], a thrown minion or monster is not blocked by {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.
* The initial projectile cannot hit targets whose {{tip|center range|center}} is behind '''Sion''', but ''can'' hit targets whose center is beyond the maximum travel distance, as long as their {{tip|edge range|hitbox}} overlaps.
* Gaining or losing {{as|AP}}, or upgrading the ability while its projectile is traveling will change its damage for every future hit. This applies to both the intial single-target projectile, as well as the minion-projectile.
* ''Roar of the Slayer'' will cast from wherever '''Sion''' is at the end of the cast time.
* {{Pending for test}}: Non-champions will also take damage from ''Roar of the Slayer'' after being overridden by another {{tip|airborne|displacement}}.
